item.title: DC Earthquake Dominates Social Media Sites: 5 Must-See Stats
item.description: DC earthquake dominates social media sites: 5 must-see stats http://t.co/nN8YBZ6
item.content:encoded: DC earthquake dominates social media sites: 5 must-see stats http://t.co/nN8YBZ6 News about the 5.8 magnitude earthquake that shook Washington, D.C. on Tuesday and was felt in cities throughout the East coast exploded online, spreading rapidly via social networking sites like Facebook, Twitter and Foursquare. Phrases and hashtags related to the earthquake, such as "5.8" and "#earthquake" quickly dominated Twitter's trending topics list. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: Get Well Ptah | Members of the WordPress Community Helping One of our Own
item.description: If you'd like to donate to help @ptahdunbar http://t.co/aWgG1Cy thx to @corymiller303 @petemall @dimensionmedia @ryancduff
item.content:encoded: If you'd like to donate to help @ptahdunbar http://t.co/aWgG1Cy thx to @corymiller303 @petemall @dimensionmedia @ryancduff After returning from WordCamp San Francisco, Ptah Dunbar was involved in a near fatal accident on his motorcycle. In a head on collision with a cab, Ptah suffered extensive cuts, bruises and broken bones when he went somewhat ungracefully through the front and back window of the afore mentioned cab. Very lucky to be alive, after a week of hospitalization, Ptah faces a number of challenges. He’s still without eyesight in his left eye which will require specialists, and is hoped to heal in time. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: getwellptah.com

item.title: China dethrones U.S. as world's largest PC market - latimes.com
item.description: China dethrones U.S. as world's largest PC market: China passed the U.S. as the largest market for personal com... http://t.co/Hn56Cr4
item.content:encoded: China dethrones U.S. as world's largest PC market: China passed the U.S. as the largest market for personal com... http://t.co/Hn56Cr4 China passed the U.S. as the largest market for personal computers in the second quarter of the year, according to new data from a research group. The shift marks the first time in history that China has passed the U.S. as the top consumer of PCs. PC shipments in China hit 18.5 million units worth about $11.9 billion the April-May-June quarter, which just edged out U.S. shipments of 17.7 million units worth about $11.7 billion in the U.S., according to International Data Corp.'s Worldwide Quarterly PC Tracker study. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: latimes.com

item.title: Gamers Today Are More Social Than You'd Think
item.description: Gamers Today Are More Social Than You'd Think http://t.co/KpNAl9e
item.content:encoded: Gamers Today Are More Social Than You'd Think http://t.co/KpNAl9e It's common knowledge that gaming is one of the most popular activities on the Web, but we often don't have a good sense of what type of person a modern gamer is. A new research report from Latitude set out to answer the question: who is today's gamer? As one participant in Latitude's study noted, traditionally gamers have been thought of as the "stereotypical, petulant and portly adult playing a viscerally violent game in his parents' basement." According to the report findings, that stereotype of the anti-social, immature gamer is outdated. Today's gamer is "social, tech-savvy, goal-oriented" and is much... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com
